title: Page Navigation
content:
There are several ways to navigate to a page in XWiki:

* [Navigation Panel](#HNavigationPanel)
* [Page Index](#HPageIndex)
* [Children list](#HChildrenlist)
* [Siblings list](#HSiblingslist)
* [Breadcrumb](#HBreadcrumb)
* [Search](#HSearch)
* [Jump To Page](#HJumpToPage)
* [Backlinks](#HBacklinks)
* [Direct URL](#HDirectURL)

If you don't see the page you're looking for, it's probably because the page is a technical page which is hidden by default (note that you can [make hidden pages visible by adjusting your profile](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/User%20Profile%20Application#HUserPreferences)). You can also type the [xxxh key combo to toggle show/hide hidden pages](/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/KeyboardShortcuts).

# Navigation Panel

This is a [panel](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Panels%20Application#HNavigationPanel) that is active by default in the [Flamingo skin](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Flamingo%20Skin) and that presents a tree-view of all pages in the wiki.

![navigationpanel.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Panels%20Application/navigationpanel.png?rev=1.4)

# Page Index

The [Page Index](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Index%20Application) offers 2 views to find pages:

* The Table view[![index-alldocs-docs.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Index%20Application/index-alldocs-docs.png?width=650&rev=1.6)](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Index%20Application/index-alldocs-docs.png?rev=1.6)
* The Tree view![indextree.png](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Navigate/WebHome/indextree.png?rev=1.1)

# Children list

This page list the children of a given page and can be accessed using the hamburger menu at the top right of a page, on pages with children.

[![children-menu.png](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Navigate/WebHome/children-menu.png?width=150&rev=1.1)](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Navigate/WebHome/children-menu.png?rev=1.1)  
*Screenshot of the children entry in the page hamburger menu.*

[![children-page.png](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Navigate/WebHome/children-page.png?width=960&rev=1.1)](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Navigate/WebHome/children-page.png?rev=1.1)  
*Screeshot of the children page.*

# Siblings list

This page list the siblings of a given page and can be accessed using the hamburger menu at the top right of a page, on terminal pages.

[![siblings-menu.png](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Navigate/WebHome/siblings-menu.png?width=150&rev=1.1)](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Navigate/WebHome/siblings-menu.png?rev=1.1)  
*Screenshot of the siblings entry in the page hamburger menu.*

[![siblings-page.png](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Navigate/WebHome/siblings-page.png?width=960&rev=1.1)](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Navigate/WebHome/siblings-page.png?rev=1.1)  
*Screeshot of the siblings page.*

# Breadcrumb

Each page displays a breadcrumb at the top where you can find the position of the current page in the hierarchy. This allows you to:

* Navigate to parent pages by clicking links in the breadcrumb![breadcrumb-limited.png](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Navigate/WebHome/breadcrumb-limited.png?rev=1.1)
* Navigate to sibling pages by opening the contextual menu inside each breadcrumb element![breadcrumbsTreeNavigation.png](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Navigate/WebHome/breadcrumbsTreeNavigation.png?rev=1.1)

# Search

You can use either:

* the [Search Suggest](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Search%20Application#HSearchSuggest)[![searchSuggest.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Search%20Application/searchSuggest.png?width=650&rev=1.8)](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Search%20Application/searchSuggest.png?rev=1.8)
* or the [Search](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Solr%20Search%20Application) to search for a page and navigate to it.[![searchPage.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Solr%20Search%20Application/searchPage.png?width=650&rev=1.2)](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Solr%20Search%20Application/searchPage.png?rev=1.2)

# Jump To Page

By using a [keyboard shortcut](/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/KeyboardShortcuts) you can summon a popup in which you can pick a page to view or edit.

[![jumpToPage.png](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Navigate/WebHome/jumpToPage.png?width=650&rev=1.1)](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Navigate/WebHome/jumpToPage.png?rev=1.1)

# Backlinks

By using the backlinks in the information panel, which list pages of the current wiki with a link to the current page, or that include an [attachment](/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Attachments) from the current page.

[![backlinks.png](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Navigate/WebHome/backlinks.png?width=650&rev=1.1)](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Navigate/WebHome/backlinks.png?rev=1.1)

# Direct URL

If you know the [reference](/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/DocumentLifecycle/) of the page you wish to navigate to, you can [directly forge a URL to navigate to it](/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/DevGuide/Architecture/URL%20Architecture/Standard%20URL%20Format/).
